distributional 0.3.2
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.1023924  9.7849456
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.0431984 0.9137405
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.06292105  0.07292198
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.3182958 -0.3182958  0.2956703 -0.7683712  0.2776635  0.3275599
#>  [7]  0.5105616 -0.7683712 -1.0971032  0.3275599
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.333884 10.263698  9.421387  7.950878  8.586671 10.325684 10.352405
#>  [8]  9.134507 10.482544  9.351706
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.1918219 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.02156832 10.12514721
variance(dist)
#>              [,1]         [,2]
#> [1,]  0.983905540 -0.009760069
#> [2,] -0.009760069  1.193360623
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.01326287
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -0.43099767 10.373514
#>  [2,] -0.44335602 10.187266
#>  [3,] -1.88534309 10.254997
#>  [4,]  1.43311745  7.834048
#>  [5,] -1.23886285 11.079136
#>  [6,] -1.09759348  8.798045
#>  [7,] -0.47324673 10.257130
#>  [8,] -0.50278975  9.260340
#>  [9,]  0.04775388 10.411668
#> [10,]  0.84687852 11.444329
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.1955586 0.0000000
